abbr.example: The <abbr title="World Health Organization">WHO</abbr> was founded in 1948.

global: attributes checks taggroup key then goes to tags

accept.info: Specifies the types of files that the server accepts (only for type="file")

accept-charset.info: Specifies the character encodings that are to be used for the form submission

accesskey.info: Specifies a shortcut key to activate/focus an element

action.info: Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted

align.info: Specifies the alignment according to surrounding elements. Use CSS instead

alt.info: Specifies an alternate text when the original element fails to display

async.info: Specifies that the script is executed asynchronously (only for external scripts)

autocomplete.info: Specifies whether the <form or the <input element should have autocomplete enabled

autofocus.info: Specifies that the element should automatically get focus when the page loads

autoplay.info: Specifies that the audio/video will start playing as soon as it is ready

bgcolor.info: Specifies the background color of an element. Use CSS instead

border.info: Specifies the width of the border of an element. Use CSS instead

checked.info: Specifies that an <input element should be pre-selected when the page loads (for type="checkbox" or type="radio")

cite.info: Specifies a URL which explains the quote/deleted/inserted text

class.info: Specifies one or more classnames for an element (refers to a class in a style sheet)

color.info: Specifies the text color of an element. Use CSS instead

cols.info: Specifies the visible width of a text area

colspan.info: Specifies the number of columns a table cell should span

content.info: Gives the value associated with the http-equiv or name attribute

contenteditable.info: Specifies whether the content of an element is editable or not

controls.info: Specifies that audio/video controls should be displayed (such as a play/pause button etc)

coords.info: Specifies the coordinates of the area

data.info: Specifies the URL of the resource to be used by the object

data-*.info: Used to store custom data private to the page or application

default.info: Specifies that the track is to be enabled if the user's preferences do not indicate that another track would be more appropriate

defer.info: Specifies that the script is executed when the page has finished parsing (only for external scripts)

dir.info: Specifies the text direction for the content in an element

dirname.info: Specifies that the text direction will be submitted

disabled.info: Specifies that the specified element/group of elements should be disabled

download.info: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyperlink

draggable.info: Specifies whether an element is draggable or not

dropzone.info: Specifies whether the dragged data is copied, moved, or linked, when dropped

enctype.info: Specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (only for method="post")

for.info: Specifies which form element(s) a label/calculation is bound to

form.info: Specifies the name of the form the element belongs to

formaction.info: Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted. Only for type="submit"

headers.info: Specifies one or more headers cells a cell is related to

height.info: Specifies the height of the element

hidden.info: Specifies that an element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant

high.info: Specifies the range that is considered to be a high value

href.info: Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to

hreflang.info: Specifies the language of the linked document

http-equiv.info: Provides an HTTP header for the information/value of the content attribute

id.info: Specifies a unique id for an element

ismap.info: Specifies an image as a server-side image-map

kind.info: Specifies the kind of text track

label.info: Specifies the title of the text track

lang.info: Specifies the language of the element's content

list.info: Refers to a <datalist element that contains pre-defined options for an <input element

loop.info: Specifies that the audio/video will start over again, every time it is finished

low.info: Specifies the range that is considered to be a low value

maxlength.info: Specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an element

media.info: Specifies what media/device the linked document is optimized for

method.info: Specifies the HTTP method to use when sending form-data

multiple.info: Specifies that a user can enter more than one value

muted.info: Specifies that the audio output of the video should be muted

name.info: Specifies the name of the element

novalidate.info: Specifies that the form should not be validated when submitted

onabort.info: Script to be run on abort

onafterprint.info: Script to be run after the document is printed

onbeforeprint.info: Script to be run before the document is printed

onbeforeunload.info: Script to be run when the document is about to be unloaded

onblur.info: Script to be run when the element loses focus

oncanplay.info: Script to be run when a file is ready to start playing (when it has buffered enough to begin)

oncanplaythrough.info: Script to be run when a file can be played all the way to the end without pausing for buffering

onchange.info: Script to be run when the value of the element is changed

onclick.info: Script to be run when the element is being clicked

oncontextmenu.info: Script to be run when a context menu is triggered

oncopy.info: Script to be run when the content of the element is being copied

oncuechange.info: Script to be run when the cue changes in a <track element

oncut.info: Script to be run when the content of the element is being cut

ondblclick.info: Script to be run when the element is being double-clicked

ondrag.info: Script to be run when the element is being dragged

ondragend.info: Script to be run at the end of a drag operation

ondragenter.info: Script to be run when an element has been dragged to a valid drop target

ondragleave.info: Script to be run when an element leaves a valid drop target

ondragover.info: Script to be run when an element is being dragged over a valid drop target

ondragstart.info: Script to be run at the start of a drag operation

ondrop.info: Script to be run when dragged element is being dropped

ondurationchange.info: Script to be run when the length of the media changes

onemptied.info: Script to be run when something bad happens and the file is suddenly unavailable (like unexpectedly disconnects)

onended.info: Script to be run when the media has reach the end (a useful event for messages like "thanks for listening")

onerror.info: Script to be run when an error occurs

onfocus.info: Script to be run when the element gets focus

onhashchange.info: Script to be run when there has been changes to the anchor part of the a URL

oninput.info: Script to be run when the element gets user input

oninvalid.info: Script to be run when the element is invalid

onkeydown.info: Script to be run when a user is pressing a key

onkeypress.info: Script to be run when a user presses a key

onkeyup.info: Script to be run when a user releases a key

onload.info: Script to be run when the element is finished loading

onloadeddata.info: Script to be run when media data is loaded

onloadedmetadata.info: Script to be run when meta data (like dimensions and duration) are loaded

onloadstart.info: Script to be run just as the file begins to load before anything is actually loaded

onmousedown.info: Script to be run when a mouse button is pressed down on an element

onmousemove.info: Script to be run as long as the  mouse pointer is moving over an element

onmouseout.info: Script to be run when a mouse pointer moves out of an element

onmouseover.info: Script to be run when a mouse pointer moves over an element

onmouseup.info: Script to be run when a mouse button is released over an element

onmousewheel.info: Script to be run when a mouse wheel is being scrolled over an element

onoffline.info: Script to be run when the browser starts to work offline

ononline.info: Script to be run when the browser starts to work online

onpagehide.info: Script to be run when a user navigates away from a page

onpageshow.info: Script to be run when a user navigates to a page

onpaste.info: Script to be run when the user pastes some content in an element

onpause.info: Script to be run when the media is paused either by the user or programmatically

onplay.info: Script to be run when the media has started playing

onplaying.info: Script to be run when the media has started playing

onpopstate.info: Script to be run when the window's history changes.

onprogress.info: Script to be run when the browser is in the process of getting the media data

onratechange.info: Script to be run each time the playback rate changes (like when a user switches to a slow motion or fast forward mode).

onreset.info: Script to be run when a reset button in a form is clicked.

onresize.info: Script to be run when the browser window is being resized.

onscroll.info: Script to be run when an element's scrollbar is being scrolled

onsearch.info: Script to be run when the user writes something in a search field (for <input="search")

onseeked.info: Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to false indicating that seeking has ended

onseeking.info: Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to true indicating that seeking is active

onselect.info: Script to be run when the element gets selected

onstalled.info: Script to be run when the browser is unable to fetch the media data for whatever reason

onstorage.info: Script to be run when a Web Storage area is updated

onsubmit.info: Script to be run when a form is submitted

onsuspend.info: Script to be run when fetching the media data is stopped before it is completely loaded for whatever reason

ontimeupdate.info: Script to be run when the playing position has changed (like when the user fast forwards to a different point in the media)

ontoggle.info: Script to be run when the user opens or closes the <details element

onunload.info: Script to be run when a page has unloaded (or the browser window has been closed)

onvolumechange.info: Script to be run each time the volume of a video/audio has been changed

onwaiting.info: Script to be run when the media has paused but is expected to resume (like when the media pauses to buffer more data)

onwheel.info: Script to be run when the mouse wheel rolls up or down over an element

open.info: Specifies that the details should be visible (open) to the user

optimum.info: Specifies what value is the optimal value for the gauge

pattern.info: Specifies a regular expression that an <input element's value is checked against

placeholder.info: Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of the element

poster.info: Specifies an image to be shown while the video is downloading, or until the user hits the play button

preload.info: Specifies if and how the author thinks the audio/video should be loaded when the page loads

readonly.info: Specifies that the element is read-only

rel.info: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document

required.info: Specifies that the element must be filled out before submitting the form

reversed.info: Specifies that the list order should be descending (9,8,7...)

rows.info: Specifies the visible number of lines in a text area

rowspan.info: Specifies the number of rows a table cell should span

sandbox.info: Enables an extra set of restrictions for the content in an <iframe

scope.info: Specifies whether a header cell is a header for a column, row, or group of columns or rows

selected.info: Specifies that an option should be pre-selected when the page loads

shape.info: Specifies the shape of the area

size.info: Specifies the width, in characters (for <input) or specifies the number of visible options (for <select)

sizes.info: Specifies the size of the linked resource

span.info: Specifies the number of columns to span

spellcheck.info: Specifies whether the element is to have its spelling and grammar checked or not

src.info: Specifies the URL of the media file

srcdoc.info: Specifies the HTML content of the page to show in the <iframe

srclang.info: Specifies the language of the track text data (required if kind="subtitles")

srcset.info: Specifies the URL of the image to use in different situations

start.info: Specifies the start value of an ordered list

step.info: Specifies the legal number intervals for an input field

style.info: Specifies an inline CSS style for an element

tabindex.info: Specifies the tabbing order of an element

target.info: Specifies the target for where to open the linked document or where to submit the form

title.info: Specifies extra information about an element

translate.info: Specifies whether the content of an element should be translated or not

usemap.info: Specifies an image as a client-side image-map

value.info: Specifies the value of the element

width.info: Specifies the width of the element

wrap.info: Specifies how the text in a text area is to be wrapped when submitted in a form
